intro: Belingia, commonly known as the "cow-calf plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The leaves are usually alternate, lance-shaped, and have a mild aromatic scent. Belingia species are often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and are sometimes used in traditional medicine. These plants are relatively rare and are of interest to botanists due to their unique morphology and ecological niche.
